concept.title: Hadoop FS
concept.shortdesc: The Hadoop FS destination writes data to the Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS). You can write the data to HDFS as flat files or Hadoop sequence files.

conbody.p: Hadoop FS destinationoverviewdestinationsHadoop FSWhen you configure a Hadoop FS destination, you define the output directory template. Hadoop FS creates output directories based on the template and the time basis. Hadoop FS writes records to the directories based on the time basis as well.
You can specify the amount of time that a record can be written to its associated directory and what happens to late records.
You can use Gzip, Bzip2, Snappy, LZ4, and other compression formats to write output files.
